gw.api.exception

Class ErrorDetail

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.exception.MessageFragment
      • gw.api.exception.ErrorDetail
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ErrorInfo, RequestErrorDetails

    public class ErrorDetail
extends MessageFragment
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class contains detail error information. A message for the end user. Also optional developer message, properties, and the cause. This class uses a builder pattern to simplify construction of the object: errorInfo.withDetail(new ErrorDetail("My.ResourceKey").with("Prop1",null).with("Prop2",null).withCause(t));

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ErrorDetail()
      This constructor will create an empty ErrorDetail object that can be populated via the builder "with..." methods.
      ErrorDetail(ErrorDetail source)
      Copy constructor
      ErrorDetail(java.lang.String displayKey)
      This constructor creates an ErrorDetail with a specific display key.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ErrorDetail

        public ErrorDetail()
        This constructor will create an empty ErrorDetail object that can be populated via the builder "with..." methods. Note that no message has been specified, so either withMessage or withDisplayKey should be called.

      • ErrorDetail

        public ErrorDetail(ErrorDetail source)
        Copy constructor
        Parameters:
        source - the error info to copy

      • ErrorDetail

        public ErrorDetail(@PropertyKey(resourceBundle="locale.display")
                   java.lang.String displayKey)
        This constructor creates an ErrorDetail with a specific display key. If the resource requires arguments, add them as properties with the with(String, Object, Property.SpecialHandling) or with(String, Object) methods.
        Parameters:
        displayKey - the display key

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public ErrorDetail clone()
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object

      • withDevMessage

        public ErrorDetail withDevMessage(@NotNull
                                  @NotNull MessageFragment message)
        This method will set the developer message for this error. Typically this will use chaining and the builder pattern like:
        new ErrorDetail().withMessage("Invalid xml")
        .withDevMessage(new MessageFragment()
        .withMessage(saxE.toString()));
        Parameters:
        message - the developer message
        Returns:
        this

      • withCause

        public ErrorDetail withCause(java.lang.Throwable cause)
        This method will set the cause for this specific detail. There maybe only one cause for each detail object.
        Parameters:
        cause - the exception that cause this error
        Returns:
        this

      • with

        public ErrorDetail with(@NotNull
                        @NotNull java.lang.String propName,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Description copied from class: MessageFragment
        This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo
        Overrides:
        with in class MessageFragment
        Parameters:
        propName - the name of the property
        value - the value of the property
        Returns:
        this

      • with

        public ErrorDetail with(@NotNull
                        @NotNull java.lang.String propName,
                        java.lang.Object value,
                        @NotNull
                        Property.SpecialHandling specialHandling)
        Description copied from class: MessageFragment
        This method will add a property for this message. There can be multiple properties. If this object uses a display key, the property values will be passed as arguments to the DisplayKey to create the message string in the order they are defined. Also, properties will be serialized with the error information in subclass (see ErrorDetail and ErrorInfo This method also permits setting special handling (see Property.SpecialHandling) for the added property.
        Overrides:
        with in class MessageFragment
        Parameters:
        propName - the name of the property
        value - the value of the property
        specialHandling - any special handling desired for the property
        Returns:
        this

      • getDevMessage

        Returns:
        the developer message

      • getDevMessageOrDefault

        public java.lang.String getDevMessageOrDefault()
        This method will get the developer message string, if a developer message has been defined, or get the super class message string.
        Returns:
        the string (it maybe null if both the developer message and the super class message are null.
